titleStmt.title: Invitation to the Planning Conference to Write the Negro History of Florida
titleStmt.author: A. Philip Randolph

publicationStmt.p: This document forms part of the project "Editing the Earth M.M. White Collection" at the University of North Florida.

msIdentifier.repository: University of North Florida, Thomas G. Carpenter Library Special Collections and Archives

msContents.summary: Randolph invites African Americans in Florida to participate in a conference to record their history for Negro History Week.

objectDesc.p: A single page typewritten letter with the Brotherhood of Sleeping Car Porter's heading. It is accompanied by a small card for recipients to record their response to the invitation.

The Negro in American History is still to make sufficient imprint on writers,
scholars and agencies attempting to reflect the true contributions that the peoples
of color have made to this great nation.

Shortly, we will be celebrating Negro History Week, largely because special
attention must be given to American people and the world about the significant contri
butions we have made and are making to the world.

Because Negroes have made such interesting and outstanding accomplishments in
the development of the history of Florida, it occurs to us that many of our friends
who helped to develop and enrich the state, should be given an opportunity to help
write Negro History of the state of Florida. To this end, we are inviting you to
join in a special planning conference to develop methods and techniques for acquir
ing material for such a history.

We are very fortunate in having Sister Eartha M. M. White as temporary
chairman of the conference.

The conference will take place February 14th at 8:00 P.M., in the Clara White
Mission, 613 W. Ashley Street30.332632 -81.664020. For additional information, kindly confer with Mrs.
White and Mr. Sam Harper of Jacksonville or B. F. McLaurin of New York City.

Enclosed please find card that I wish you would return indicating your interest
and desire to cooperate.

I look forward with a great deal of pleasure to having your participation in
this all importantall-important conference.

closer.signed: A. Philip Randolph A. Philip Randolph International President
